Join a community garden: If all supermarkets were to close down, one could consider joining a community garden. This would provide a sustainable source of fresh produce and other vegetables. It would also be an opportunity to meet like-minded individuals who are passionate about gardening and sustainability.

Visit local farmers' markets: Another option would be to visit local farmers' markets. These markets typically offer a variety of fresh produce, meats, and other products from local farmers. This would be a great way to support the local economy and get fresh, healthy food.

Hunt and fish: If one has the skills and equipment, they could consider hunting and fishing for their food. This would provide a sustainable source of meat and fish, and would also be a great way to spend time outdoors.

Grow your own food: If one has the space and resources, they could consider growing their own food. This could include growing fruits, vegetables, and herbs in a garden or on a balcony. This would provide a sustainable source of fresh produce and would also be a great way to reduce one's carbon footprint.
